result.execSummary:
The defendant Antwone Lamone Brooks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any sentence; with release for work, inmate work assignments, Doctor Appointments and mental health treatment, credit for 3 days time served.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Maintain full time work within any medical restrictions.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.

Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antwone Lamone Brooks in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case proceeds to Plea and Sentencing.
AS TO COUNT  1- 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Court ordered defendant to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; with release for work, inmate work assignments, Doctor Appointments and mental health treatment, credit for 3 days time served.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 1 YEAR with the following conditions:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- Maintain full time work within any medical restrictions.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
Court denies the Defense request for early termination of probation.
Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated April 6, 2015, received and filed.

Defendant Antwone Lamone Brooks in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense counsel received discovery and offer.  Court orders case for adjourned Plea and Sentencing on 4-7-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated March 4, 2015, received and filed.

Defendant Antwone Lamone Brooks in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Lindsey Anderson, student intern under the supervision of Ron Dague for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 2/20/15.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Antwone Lamone Brooks in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  
Defendant Antwone Lamone Brooks in custody.  Gary D. Mahkorn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
